verses.verse: And it happened in the time; He also was making His way through each city and village in order speaking publicly and sharing the good news of the empire of God, and the Twelve were together with Him
and some women who had been healed from evil spirits and weaknesses: Mary (the one called "Magdalene" from whom seven demons had come out),
Joanna (a wife of Chuza, Herod's administrator), Susanna, and many different ones, some who were serving Him out of the things that are with them.
As a big crowd was coming together and the people were also traveling to Him from each city, He told through an illustration:

"The one who seeds went out for the purpose to seed his batch of seeds. And during the time for him to be seeding, certainly there was a seed that fell along the road and was traipsed on. And the winged birds of the sky ate it.
And a different seed fell on the rock. And after sprouting up, it shriveled up because of the fact for it to not be having moisture.
And a different seed fell in the middle of the thorns. And after sprouting up together with it, the thorns choked it out.

And a different seed fell on the soil, the good soil. And after sprouting up, it produced a hundred times the fruit." As He said these things, He was hollering, "The person who has ears to be listening must listen."
His students were asking Him, saying, "What is this illustration?"

Jesus said, "To you it has been given to know the secrets of the empire of God, but to the rest I speak in illustrations so that as they see, they may not see, and as they hear, they may not understand.
This is the illustration. The batch of seeds is the message of God.
The people along the road are the people who hear. After that, the Accuser comes and takes the message away from their heart so that they might not trust and be rescued.
The people on the rock are people who when they hear, with happiness they accept the message. And these do not have root, who trust for a time, and in a time of trouble, they stay away.

The seed that fell into the thorns, these are the people who heard, and traveling under worries, wealth, and pleasures of the life, they come together, are choked off, and do not bring it to the conclusion.
The seed in the nice soil, these people are any who heard the message with a nice and good heart. They hold steady and produce fruit with persistence.
No one, after lighting a lamp, covers it up with a container or puts it beneath a cot, but he puts it on a lampstand so that the people traveling in may see the light.
You see, a thing is not hidden that will not become shown, nor hidden away that will not be known and come into a shown place.
So look out how you hear. You see, whoever has, it will be given to him, and whoever does not have, even what he seems to be having will be taken away from him."
His mother and brothers showed up to where He was, and they were not able to meet up with Him because of the crowd.
And it was reported to Him by people who said, "Your mother and Your brothers have been standing outside wanting to see You."
When Jesus responded, He said to them, "My mother and My brothers are these people, the ones listening to the message of God and doing it."
And it happened during one of the days; He and His students also climbed on board into a boat, He said to them, "We will go across to the other side of the lake," and they took off.
As they sailed, He fell asleep. And a sudden burst of wind stepped down onto the lake, and they were being filled totally up and were in danger.
After coming forward, they woke Him up, saying, "Boss, boss, we are being ruined." When Jesus got up, He forbid the wind and the wave of water, they stopped, and there became a calm.

He said to them, "Where is your trust?" After being afraid, they were amazed, saying to each other, "Who is this Person, then? Because even to the winds and the water He gives the directive and they obey Him."
And they sailed down to the rural area of the Gadarenes, a certain area that is on the opposite side of Galilee.

When He came out on the land, a certain man came to meet Him from the city who had demons for an adequate amount of time. And he was not setting clothes on himself and not staying in a house, but among the graves.

When he saw Jesus and after yelling out, he fell toward Him and said with a loud voice, "What is there between me and You, Jesus, Son of God, the Highest God? I plead with You, You should not torture me."

You see, He passed the order on to the spirit, the spirit that was not clean, to come out from the person; for many times it had seized him, and he was being detained with a chain and foot shackles as he was guarded. And ripping the restraints apart, he was being driven by the demon into the backcountry.
Jesus asked him, saying, "What is a name for you?" He said, "Legion" (the Latin word for regiment), because many demons went into him.
And they were encouraging Him so that He would not give the directive to them to go off into the bottomless area.
A herd of an adequate amount of hogs was there grazing on the mountain. And they were encouraging Him that He would give them permission to go into those hogs, and He gave them permission.
When the demons came out from the person, they went into the hogs, the herd rushed down the steep slope into the lake, and they were choked out.
When the people grazing them saw what had happened, they escaped. And after going away, they reported it in the city and in the fields.

They came out to see what had happened. And they came to Jesus and found the person (from whom the demons had come out) sitting (having been clothed) and properly focused beside the feet of Jesus, and they were afraid.
The people who also saw it reported to them how the man who had demons was rescued.

And absolutely all the large number from the surrounding rural area of the Gadarenes asked Him to go away from them because they were being constrained by huge fear. After He climbed on board into the boat, He returned.
The man from whom the demons had come out was pleading with Him to be together with Him, but Jesus dismissed him, saying,
"Return to your house, and describe as many things as God did for you." And he went off speaking publicly throughout the whole city about as many things as Jesus did for him.
It happened in the time for Jesus to return; the crowd gladly accepted Him. You see, everyone was expecting Him.
And look, a man came to whom belonged the name Jairus, and he was a head of the synagogue. And after he got down beside Jesus' feet, he was encouraging Him to come into his house
because the only biological daughter to him was as if she were twelve years old and she was dying. But during the time for Him to be going back, the crowds were coming together and choking Him.
And a woman who was in a discharge of blood for twelve years (someone who consumed almost all of her livelihood on doctors) did not have the strength to be healed by any of them.
When she came up from behind, she touched the fringe of His robe, and at once the discharge of her blood stood still.

And Jesus said, "Who is the one who touched Me?" As everyone was denying it, Peter and the people with him said, "Boss, the crowds are constraining and squashing You, and You are saying, 'Who is the one that touched Me?'"
Jesus said, "Someone touched Me. You see, I knew the ability that went out from Me."

When the woman saw that she was not unnoticed, she came trembling and got down close to Him. She reported to Him in the sight of the entire group the reason why she touched Him and how she was cured at once.
Jesus said to her, "Daughter, be courageous. Your trust has rescued you. Travel into peace."
As He is still speaking, someone comes from the side of the synagogue's head ruler, saying, "Your daughter has died. Do not irritate the teacher."
When Jesus heard it, He responded to him, saying, "Don't be afraid. Just trust, and she will be rescued."
When He came into the house, He did not leave anyone to come in together with Him except Peter, John, James, the father of the girl, and the mother.
Everyone was crying and beating their chests in grief for her. Jesus said, "Don't cry. She did not die, but she is sleeping."
And they were laughing at Him, having seen that she died.
After He sent everyone outside and took hold of her hand, He hollered, saying, "The girl, get up."
And her spirit turned around, she got up at once, and He specifically arranged for her to be given something to eat.
And her parents were astounded. Jesus passed the order on to them to tell no one what had happened.
